node.title: Swiftwater rescue experts say people still not taking deadly risk seriously enough
node.description: As the rain continues to fall in what's already been a wet summer, Queensland's swiftwater rescue experts implore people to take the risk of flooding seriously, with four lives lost in Queensland in a matter of weeks.
node.content:
["Swiftwater rescues are the single most-dangerous environment Queensland's technical rescue specialists will face and as the wet summer continues they are urging people to take the risks seriously.", "In a state prone to natural disasters, the directive \"if it's flooded, forget it\" is one residents hear often \u2014 but it's also one that Queensland Fire and Emergency Services station officer Trent Leis says more people need to take to heart.", "\"For the untrained, it's even more dangerous,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"If you can, don't even get in your car \u2014 if you know a storm is coming, just stay at home, if you're at the shops, stay at the shops, but don't go on the road if you don't have to.\"", "", "
Keeping windows down in a flooded car makes the task of rescuers much easier.\u00a0(Supplied: QFES)
", "In the past three weeks, there's been four flood-related deaths in Queensland, including two in recent days in Brisbane.\u00a0", "One woman's car was swept from a car park in the northern suburb of Aspley", "A 75-year-old woman died after her car was swept into treacherous waters in Pullenvale in the city's outer west.\u00a0", "Station officer\u00a0Leis is one of Queensland's firefighters specially trained to enter the water and is a senior swiftwater instructor.\u00a0", "He said he had attended flooding emergencies all along the east coast, from Cairns to recent flood events in New South Wales.", "", "
A woman died in floodwaters in Aspley in Brisbane's north on Thursday night, the fourth flood-related death in a fortnight.
", "\"There are some that generally stick in your head a little bit more,\" Station Officer Leis\u00a0said.", "\"They're the ones that are pressurised, where people are clinging to a vehicle and they've been washed downstream \u2026 grabbing onto trees.\"", "He starts to calculate how to safely and effectively conduct a rescue from the moment he gets the call.", "", "
The female driver of this ute submerged by flooding near Dalby was rescued by a local grazier on a jetski.(Supplied: Doug Brown)
", "\"I need to look after not only the people that we're rescuing but also the people I've arrived with.", "\"My crew are super important. Without them in a safe position it's super hard to perform a rescue in a safe manner. Emotionally, you need to be able to adapt very quickly \u2014 whatever that rescue plan that you have developed may change significantly from the start to the end.\"", "", "
Swiftwater rescue technicians had to rescue a man after his truck ran into floodwater near Goondiwindi last month.(Supplied: Queensland Fire and Emergency)
", "Queensland Fire and Emergency Services crews undergo training in Caloundra, Tasmania and far north Queensland's Tully River \u2014 where he admits the fast-flowing, clean \"and somewhat inviting\" water doesn't bear much resemblance to dirty, brown and often cold floodwaters.", "All Queensland firefighters are trained in a level of rescue response, but there is a second level of specialised training for disciplines such as swiftwater rescue, vertical rescue, urban search and rescue and rescues from confined spaces and trenches.", "Superintendent Brad Moore is now the executive manager of the QFES unit, after a long career \"on the tools\" \u2014 including two months spent away from home over the 2010/11 summer, which brought devastating floods.", "", "
Queenslanders mark 10 years since the 2011 floods
", "\"We were deployed up north when the rains started to come, that Christmas in 2010 we actually spent in a ambulance station in Ingham,\" he said.", "\"From that point on, we moved down to the back of Brisbane, out to St George, Dirranbandi, back to St George, back to Brisbane and then back to Condamine.\"", "He said it takes a while to sit back and collect your thoughts after responding to an incident \u2014 especially after natural disasters.", "\"It's kind of surreal. When you've got time to sit down, start talking to your colleagues and your friends about what's just happened, you start to remember everything you've done and you start to realise the enormity,\" Superintendent Moore said.", "
Not all floods are alike
", "Floodwaters also behave differently in different parts of the state.", "\"Up north you've got the sugarcane area, the way the water flows is different to say, St George,\"\u00a0Superintendent Moore said.\u00a0", "\"St George, Dirranbandi, it's like a big open ocean \u2014 the water is a little bit more slow moving but its inundated absolutely everywhere.", "", "
SES volunteers trying to rescue a Townsville resident from flooding in February 2019.(AAP: Andrew Rankin)
", "\"You come then into Brisbane to where, in the urban built-up environment, the water will run off very quickly, it has smaller areas to run off \u2026 the water will rise extremely quickly and trap people without warning.\"", "Technical rescue crews also carry out welfare checks and damage assessments.", "The outlook for this severe weather season forecasts an above average risk of flooding for the east and north of Australia.\u00a0", "", "
Firefighters from across Queensland in swiftwater rescue training in the Tully River.(ABC News: Jemima Burt)
", "Station Officer Leis said there are a few key things that can make their lives easier in a swiftwater rescue from a car.", "\"Window down for a start, because it's much easier to get out of a vehicle with the window down, and that needs to happen as soon as you can because we have electric windows,\" he said.", "\"If they get swept off a causeway for any reason, we've got more chance of survivability. Also, the seatbelt off and the handbrake on, because the handbrake will help settle the vehicle especially on a concrete or bitumen environment.\""]
